DOC.brief_summary: This study is done to estimate prevalence of the main detectable lung and cardiovascular complications by an ultrasound realized in room of post-interventional supervision at the patients whose duration of general anesthesia is superior at one hour after a surgery to risk
DOC.brief_title: Can Point of Care Chest Ultrasound Predicts Pulmonary Complications After Major Surgery?
DOC.criteria: Physical status score > 1 Anesthesia of duration > 1 hour Visceral, orthopaedic, vascular, thoracic surgery, neurosurgery Technical incapacity of accessibility to the ultrasound window Cardiac or pulmonary transplant
